planets.name: Coruscant
planets.quote: The entire planet is one big city.
planets.notes: Ecumenopolis and seat of the Galactic Senate and later the Imperial Palace.

planets.name: Alderaan
planets.notes: Peaceful, mountainous world destroyed by the first Death Star in 0 BBY.

planets.name: Corellia
planets.notes: Shipbuilding powerhouse—Corellian Engineering Corporation.

planets.name: Chandrila
planets.quote: Beacon of the early New Republic.
planets.notes: Agrarian core world and New Republic's first capital post-Endor.

planets.name: Brentaal
planets.notes: Sits at a strategic junction of major routes.

planets.name: Cato Neimoidia
planets.notes: One of several purse worlds of the Trade Federation.

planets.name: Kuat
planets.notes: Massive ring-shaped shipyards built around the planet.

planets.name: Duro
planets.notes: Surface heavily polluted—citizens live in orbital cities.

planets.name: Commenor
planets.famous: Queen Talyon, later occupied by First Order
planets.notes: Important shipping lane world in the Colonies region.

planets.name: Bothawui
planets.quote: Many Bothans died to bring us this information.
planets.notes: Homeworld of the Bothans, famed for intelligence networks.

planets.name: Ord Mantell
planets.notes: Known for junkyards and mercenary work.

planets.name: Mon Cala
planets.notes: Ocean world of the Mon Calamari and Quarren.

planets.name: Takodana
planets.quote: Ancient castle on a forested lake.
planets.notes: Neutral haven frequented by smugglers for centuries.

planets.name: Cantonica
planets.notes: Casino city draws the galaxy’s elite and war profiteers.

planets.name: Onderon
planets.quote: A jungle world that resists occupiers.
planets.notes: Moon Dxun shares atmosphere; history of rebellions.

planets.name: Balmorra
planets.quote: Industrial foundries hum day and night.
planets.notes: Known for arms manufacturing since the Old Republic.

planets.name: Geonosis
planets.notes: Petrified spires and hive cities; Site of the First Battle of Geonosis.

planets.name: Tatooine
planets.quote: You will never find a more wretched hive of scum and villainy.
planets.notes: Desert planet with twin suns; Mos Eisley, Mos Espa.

planets.name: Ryloth
planets.notes: Tidally locked world of deserts and jungles.

planets.name: Mustafar
planets.notes: Volcanic world; site of Anakin vs. Obi‑Wan and Vader’s fortress.

planets.name: Utapau
planets.notes: General Grievous hunted here by Obi‑Wan Kenobi.

planets.name: Felucia
planets.notes: Clone Wars battles—Order 66 executed here.

planets.name: Saleucami
planets.notes: Outer Rim Sieges stronghold.

planets.name: Bespin
planets.quote: This deal is getting worse all the time.
planets.notes: Gas giant with tibanna mining at Cloud City.

planets.name: Hoth
planets.notes: Site of the Rebel Alliance’s evacuation in 3 ABY.

planets.name: Endor
planets.quote: Shield generator guarded in the forest moon.
planets.notes: Battle of Endor ended the Empire’s reign.

planets.name: Dagobah
planets.quote: Do or do not. There is no try.
planets.notes: Remote swamp world—Yoda’s self‑exile refuge.

planets.name: Yavin IV
planets.notes: Base used to launch the attack on the first Death Star.

planets.name: Lothal
planets.notes: Key world in the Lothal sector; TIE Defender project.

planets.name: Scarif
planets.notes: Imperial data vault containing Death Star plans.

planets.name: Dantooine
planets.quote: An abandoned base could be found there.
planets.notes: Used as a decoy location by Leia to Tarkin.

planets.name: Kessel
planets.quote: Watch the maw and the maelstrom.
planets.notes: Smuggling route known as the Kessel Run skirts black holes.

planets.name: Eriadu
planets.quote: Ruthless efficiency in the Outer Rim.
planets.notes: Industrial capital; anchor of the Hydian Way.

planets.name: Kamino
planets.quote: Endless storms over an endless ocean.
planets.notes: Created Jango Fett–based clone army for the Republic.

planets.name: Rishi
planets.notes: Strategic listening post during the Clone Wars.

planets.name: Sullust
planets.quote: Volcanic caverns, loyal to the Alliance.
planets.notes: Staging ground for the assault on Endor.

planets.name: Mandalore
planets.notes: Beskar-forging Mandalorian homeworld with a fractured history.

planets.name: Concordia
planets.notes: Once used by Death Watch as a base.

planets.name: Nevarro
planets.notes: Host to Greef Karga’s operations.

planets.name: Ilum
planets.quote: Source of many Jedi lightsaber crystals.
planets.notes: Seized and hollowed into Starkiller Base by the First Order.

planets.name: Ahch-To
planets.quote: The first Jedi Temple lies here.
planets.notes: Remote ocean world dotted with rocky islands and caretakers.

planets.name: Exegol
planets.quote: A hidden world of perpetual storms.
planets.notes: Final Order fleet constructed in secret shipyards.

planets.name: Jakku
planets.notes: Site of a decisive battle after Endor; scavenging culture.

planets.name: Naboo
planets.notes: Theed capital; birthplace of Padmé and Palpatine.

planets.name: Rodia
planets.notes: Rodian homeworld; strong hunting traditions.

planets.name: Batuu
planets.notes: Sits on old sub-hyperspace routes.

planets.name: Crait
planets.notes: Battle of Crait staged the Resistance escape from the First Order.

planets.name: D'Qar
planets.notes: Destroyed by the First Order’s dreadnought attack.

planets.name: Polis Massa
planets.quote: Asteroids harbor a secret med center.
planets.notes: Kenobi and Yoda brought Padmé here after Mustafar.

planets.name: Eadu
planets.notes: Research world for the Death Star kyber program.

planets.name: Serenno
planets.notes: Separatist leader’s home, steeped in old wealth.

planets.name: Mygeeto
planets.notes: Order 66 executed here against Ki‑Adi‑Mundi.
